meanings.definition: To claim or seize without justification
meanings.sent1: He arrogates all the credit for our group project.
meanings.sent2: The thief arrogates items from the store without paying.
meanings.sent3: She arrogates the last cookie from the jar, leaving none for others.
meanings.sent4: The dictator arrogates power and control over the entire country.
meanings.sent5: The bully arrogates the swing on the playground, not letting anyone else have a turn.

meanings.definition: To assume or take on a particular role or responsibility
meanings.sent1: The actor arrogates the role of the brave hero in the play.
meanings.sent2: She arrogates the duty of feeding the class pet every day.
meanings.sent3: The cat arrogates the role of the king of the house, lounging on the couch all day.
meanings.sent4: The new employee arrogates the responsibility of organizing the office party.
meanings.sent5: The student arrogates the role of the teacher, explaining the lesson to classmates.
